subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Religious Trauma: When Faith Hurts
description: One-minute skill: Religious Trauma: When Faith Hurts.

hook.text: Shame, fear of hell, rejection by community. For millions, religion isn't comfort. It's the source of deep harm.

buildup.text: Religious trauma syndrome describes anxiety, depression, and PTSD from authoritarian religious upbringing.

discovery.text: The damage comes from conditional love: you're accepted if you believe correctly. Doubt equals rejection and damnation.

twist.text: Many trauma survivors still want spirituality. They seek faith without fear. Healing means separating God from abuse.

climax.text: Religion can heal or harm. The difference isn't the faith but how leaders wield it. Power corrupts sacred spaces.

punchline.text: Faith can heal or harm. The difference is how leaders use their power.

quiz.question: What is religious trauma?
options: Psychological harm from authoritarian religious environments and conditional acceptance
